Class UpdateUnit

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.SwingWorker<javax.swing.JTree,java.lang.Void>
      de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.worker.UpdateUnit
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Future<javax.swing.JTree>, java.util.concurrent.RunnableFuture<javax.swing.JTree>
public class UpdateUnit
extends javax.swing.SwingWorker<javax.swing.JTree,java.lang.Void>

This worker has the job of updating the Unit tree component. If you wanna know more about what an unit might be, have a look at Unit.

The update is done in background to avoid getting stuck in the EDT. With the unit data structure being observed by the view DataGeneratorView as the observer we get always the latest updates on time and without ever pinging the model layer.

Since:
Apr/24/09
Version:
0.1
Author:
Michael Munz

Constructor Detail

UpdateUnit

public UpdateUnit(java.util.List<java.lang.String> data,
                  java.lang.String name,
                  javax.swing.JTree tree,
                  javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeModel model)
constructor is passed the latest data of an unit. The unit is identified by name. Also handed down are tree component and its tree model. Those elements are needed to reflect the update accordingly.

Parameters:
data - the latest data of an unit element.
name - the unit element is identified here. That's the name of the element that has send notification.
tree - the tree component. It's from the UI.
model - the tree model resides in tree.
